thread.title: Kids Calendar: Oct. 20-26

author: democratandchronicle.com
title: Kids Calendar: Oct. 20-26
text:
Tuesday Babies and Books: For babies and toddlers 24 months and younger, with an adult. 10:30 a.m. Oct. 20. Chili Public Library, 3333 Chili Ave., Chili. Free. (585) 889-2200 or www.chililibrary.org.
Babies and Books: Stories, songs, rhymes and more. For ages 2 and younger. 10:30 to 11:15 a.m. Oct. 20. Seymour Library, 161 East Ave., Brockport. (585) 637-1050 or www.seymourlibraryweb.org.
Baby Sing, Sign, and Play Class: For ages 2 and younger. 10:30 to 11 a.m. Oct. 20. Seymour Library, 161 East Ave., Brockport. (585) 637-1050 or www.seymourlibraryweb.org.
Gro-Moore Farms Fall Family Fun: Attractions (for families with children up to third grade) include the ABC’s of Agriculture Maze, No Left Turn Maze, Haunted House, The Fun House for Kids, a petting zoo, pumpkin slide and many fall scenes to enjoy. Special weekend activities run from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays and include The John Deere Express Train Ride, Super Slide, Mini Golf, Tractor-drawn Wagon Rides, Duck Races, Tattoo Parlor, Pumpkin Painting, Trike Track, Straw Crawl for the little ones. 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Monday through Friday; 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Saturday and Sunday, through Oct. 31. Gro-Moore Farms, 2811 East Henrietta Road, Henrietta. Free; $10 per person for special weekend activities. (585) 359-3310 or www.gromoore.com.
Preschool Activity Club: For ages 2-5, with their caregivers. 11:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m. Oct. 20. Seymour Library, 161 East Ave., Brockport. (585) 637-1050 or www.seymourlibraryweb.org.
Read to Annie: Bring in or pick out your favorite story to read to Annie, our favorite shih-tzu. 5:30 p.m. Oct. 20. Registration required. Brighton Memorial Library, 2300 Elmwood Ave., Brighton. Free. (585) 784-5300 or www.brightonlibrary.org.
Sid the Science Kid: The Super-Duper Exhibit: Children can step into Sid’s world and become science kids themselves as they discover and investigate everyday science questions around Sid’s home, and at school-in the Super Fab Lab and on the playground. Through hands-on activities, kids use scientific tools and thinking to learn about simple machines, the laws of motion, magnetism, air power, and the five senses. Through Jan. 24. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Free with museum admission. (585) 263-2700 or www.museumofplay.org.
Stories and More: For children of all ages with an adult. 9:45 to 10:15 a.m. Oct. 20. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. Free. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org.
Teen Tuesday: For students in grades 9-12. 2:30 to 4 p.m. Oct. 20. Penfield Public Library, 1985 Baird Road, Penfield. Free. (585) 340-8720 or www.penfieldlibrary.org.
Wee Read: Baby and Toddler Story Time: For ages 3 and younger, with a caregiver. 10 to 11 a.m. Tuesdays, through Dec. 1. Children’s Center. Central Library of Rochester and Monroe County, 115 South Ave. Free. (585) 428-8150 or www.libraryweb.org.
Wednesday
Buffalo Bills/Rex Ryan Corn Maze: More than 35 activities including zip lines, bounce pillows, farm animals, barnyard barrel train, nature trail, giant slides, hayrides and apple cannons. 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Oct. 21 and 23; 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Oct. 24 to 25. Stokoe Farms, 656 South Road, Wheatland. (585) 889-0770 or www.stokoefarms.com.
His and Herstory: Travel through his and herstory, discussing books and learning how people lived in times gone by. Stop by the Children’s Desk to pick up this month’s book. For grades 3-5. 4 p.m. Oct. 21. Chili Public Library, 3333 Chili Ave., Chili. (585) 889-2200 or www.chililibrary.org.
Pajamarama Story Time: Come in pajamas with your favorite stuffed animal, doll, or blanket and enjoy stories before bedtime. For ages 6 and younger. 6:30 to 7 p.m. Oct. 21. Mendon Public Library, 22 N. Main St., Honeoye Falls. Free. (585) 624-6067 or www.mendonlibrary.org.
Parachute Power: For ages 3 and older with an adult. 10:30 to 11 a.m. Oct. 21. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. Free. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org.
Reading, Rhythm and Rhyme: For ages 18 months through 3 with an adult. 10:30 to 11 a.m. Oct. 21. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org.
Thursday
Art and Story Stroll: Creative Workshop instructor Amy J. Fisher reads Olivia... and the Missing Toy by Ian Falconer. For children 2-5 with accompanying adult. 11 a.m. Oct. 22. Registration required. Memorial Art Gallery, 500 University Ave. Free to children ($5 per adult). (585) 276-8959 or www.mag.rochester.edu.
Bop Til you Drop Family Dance Party: For children and adults of all ages. 10 to 10:30 a.m. Oct. 22. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. Free. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org.
Building Buddies Club: Encourages creativity, fine motor skills, and parallel play for toddlers and young children. For ages 1-4. 10 to 11 a.m. Oct. 22. Mendon Public Library, 22 N. Main St., Honeoye Falls. Free. (585) 624-6067 or www.mendonlibrary.org.
Mysterious Family Improv Night: An interactive improvisational comedy show by Defiant Monkey Improv. 6 to 6:45 p.m. Oct. 22. Charlotte Branch Library, 3615 Lake Ave. Free. (585) 428-8216.
Pajama Story Time: Wear your pajamas and bring a stuffed friend. For children of all ages with an adult. 7 p.m. Oct. 22. Chili Public Library, 3333 Chili Ave., Chili. (585) 889-2200 or www.chililibrary.org.
Preschool Story Time: For ages 2-5 with caregivers. 10:30 to 11 a.m. Oct. 22. Seymour Library, 161 East Ave., Brockport. (585) 637-1050 or www.seymourlibraryweb.org.
Simply Stories: For children of all ages with an adult. 10 a.m. Oct. 22. Chili Public Library, 3333 Chili Ave., Chili. (585) 889-2200 or www.chililibrary.org.
Toddler Time: For ages 18 to 36 months, with an adult. 10:30 a.m. Thursdays and Fridays. Victor Farmington Library, 15 W. Main St., Victor. (585) 924-2637 or www.victorfarmingtonlibrary.org.
Friday
Babies Love Books: For ages 15 months and younger with an adult. 9:30 to 10 a.m. Oct. 23. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. Free. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org.
Buffalo Bills/Rex Ryan Corn Maze: More than 35 activities including zip lines, bounce pillows, farm animals, barnyard barrel train, nature trail, giant slides, hayrides and apple cannons. 10 a.m. to 2 p.m. Oct. 23; 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Oct. 24 to 25. Stokoe Farms, 656 South Road, Wheatland. (585) 889-0770 or www.stokoefarms.com.
Color Story Time: Celebrate National Color Day with stories, songs and doing a simple color experiment. For ages 2-5. 10 a.m. Oct. 23. Registration required. Chili Public Library, 3333 Chili Ave., Chili. (585) 889-2200 or www.chililibrary.org.
Family Halloween Fun and Pizza Dinner: Activities include games, trick-or-treating, hayrides, crafts and music. Dinner includes personal pizza, salad, chips and beverage. Dinner 5:30-7:30 p.m.; activities 6 p.m. to 8 p.m. Penfield Community Center, 1985 Baird Road, Penfield. $5 for dinner; activities are free. (585) 340-8655.
Gro-Moore Farms Fall Family Fun: Attractions (for families with children up to third grade) include the ABC’s of Agriculture Maze, No Left Turn Maze, Haunted House, The Fun House for Kids, a petting zoo, pumpkin slide and many fall scenes to enjoy. Special weekend activities run from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays and include The John Deere Express Train Ride, Super Slide, Mini Golf, Tractor-drawn Wagon Rides, Duck Races, Tattoo Parlor, Pumpkin Painting, Trike Track, Straw Crawl for the little ones. 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Monday through Friday; 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Saturday and Sunday, through Oct. 31. Gro-Moore Farms, 2811 East Henrietta Road, Henrietta. Free; $10 per person for special weekend activities. (585) 359-3310 or www.gromoore.com.
Rabbit Hole: A production of David Lindsay-Abaire’s award-winning drama,. 7 p.m. Oct. 23 to 24; 5 p.m. Oct. 25. School of the Arts, 45 Prince St. $10; $8 students, children and seniors; $5 SOTA students with ID. (585) 242-7682 or www.sotarochester.org.
Sid the Science Kid: The Super-Duper Exhibit: Children can step into Sid’s world and become science kids themselves as they discover and investigate everyday science questions around Sid’s home, and at school-in the Super Fab Lab and on the playground. Through hands-on activities, kids use scientific tools and thinking to learn about simple machines, the laws of motion, magnetism, air power, and the five senses. Through Jan. 24. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Free with museum admission. (585) 263-2700 or www.museumofplay.org.
Story Time: For toddlers to preschool. 10 to 10:30 a.m. Oct. 23. Mendon Public Library, 22 N. Main St., Honeoye Falls. Free. (585) 624-6067 or www.mendonlibrary.org.
Toddler Story Time: For ages 1-4. 10:30 a.m. Oct. 23. Lift Bridge Book Shop, 45 Main St., Brockport. Free. (585) 637-2260 or www.liftbridgebooks.com.
Toddler Time: For ages 18 to 36 months, with an adult. 10:30 a.m. Thursdays and Fridays. Victor Farmington Library, 15 W. Main St., Victor. (585) 924-2637 or www.victorfarmingtonlibrary.org.
Saturday
Another Day of Magic: For students in grades 6-12. 1 to 5 p.m. Oct. 24. Seymour Library, 161 East Ave., Brockport. Free. (585) 637-1050 or www.seymourlibraryweb.org.
Darth Vader: Get ready for the new Star Wars movie - games, stories, prizes and a costume contest. For all ages. 11 a.m. Oct. 24. Registration required. Lift Bridge Book Shop, 45 Main St., Brockport. $5. (585) 637-2260 or www.liftbridgebooks.com.
Electricity Theater: Featuring two custom-built, 6-foot Tesla coils modified to produce musical bolts of lightning. Noon, 2 and 4 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays. Rochester Museum & Science Center, 657 East Ave. Free with museum admission. (585) 271-1880, (585) 697-1942 or www.rmsc.org.
Fall Craft: Celebrate fall. Children’s Center. 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Oct. 24. Central Library of Rochester and Monroe County, 115 South Ave. Free. (585) 428-8150 or www.libraryweb.org.
Fall Family Fun at the Garden Factory: Activities for kids, Singing Pumpkin Light Show, carnival rides, arts and crafts, games, face painting, special visitors, petting zoo, animal rescue groups and more. 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays; through Oct. 25. Garden Factory, 2126 Buffalo Road, Gates. Free admission. ($10 for a book of 20 tickets). (585) 247-6236 or www.gardenfactoryny.com.
Fall into Canandaigua: Family-friendly and fun seasonal activities, including a costume parade and contest, a pumpkin carving station, musical petting zoo, horse drawn wagon rides, face painting, the YMCA Jack-O-Lantern 5k and more. 10 a.m. and 5 p.m. Oct. 24. Main Street (Route 332), Canandaigua. Free admission. (585) 396-0300 or www.downtownCanandaigua.com.
Gro-Moore Farms Fall Family Fun: Attractions (for families with children up to third grade) include the ABC’s of Agriculture Maze, No Left Turn Maze, Haunted House, The Fun House for Kids, a petting zoo, pumpkin slide and many fall scenes to enjoy. Special weekend activities run from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays and include The John Deere Express Train Ride, Super Slide, Mini Golf, Tractor-drawn Wagon Rides, Duck Races, Tattoo Parlor, Pumpkin Painting, Trike Track, Straw Crawl for the little ones. 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Monday through Friday; 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Saturday and Sunday, through Oct. 31. Gro-Moore Farms, 2811 East Henrietta Road, Henrietta. Free; $10 per person for special weekend activities. (585) 359-3310 or www.gromoore.com.
Halloween Trolley Express: For ages 3 and older. Visitors are encouraged to wear a costume. Reservations required. 11:00 a.m. and 12:30, 2:00, 3:30 and 5:00 p.m. Oct. 24. New York Museum of Transportation, 6393 East River Road, Rush. $12 per person. (585) 533-1113 or www.nymtmuseum.org/halloween.
My Planets: Show about our solar system for the youngest explorers For ages 3-5. 10 a.m. Oct. 24. Rochester Museum & Science Center’s Strasenburgh Planetarium, 657 East Ave. $7; $6 for seniors, college students with ID and ages 3-18; free to ages 2 and younger. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org.
National Chemistry Week: “Chemistry Colors Our World” hands-on experiments. 11 a.m. and 3 p.m Oct. 24 and 25. Rochester Museum & Science Center, 657 East Ave. Free with museum admission. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org.
Playing with Power: Celebrating 30 Years of the Nintendo Entertainment System: Explore the history of Nintendo and trace the evolution of its groundbreaking Nintendo Entertainment System (NES). Learn about Nintendo’s storied past as a producer of games, toys, and other playthings by viewing unique Nintendo-produced artifacts from The Strong’s collections. Oct. 24 to Jan. 24. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Free with museum admission. (585) 263-2700 or www.museumofplay.org.
Playing with Power: Celebrating 30 Years of the Nintendo Entertainment System Exhibit Opening: Learn the history of Nintendo and trace the evolution of its groundbreaking Nintendo Entertainment System. 11 a.m., noon, and 1 p.m. Oct. 24; 1 and 2 p.m. Oct. 25. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Included with general museum admission fees. (585) 263-2700 or www.museumofplay.org.
Pumpkin Patch and Harvest Festival: Family friendly activities, including the Buffalo Bills Rex Ryan corn maze, zip lines, bounce pillows, nature trail, petting farm, hayrides, straw fort, giant slides, apple cannons and more. 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturdays and Sunday, through Oct. 25. Stokoe Farms, 656 South Road, Wheatland. $12; $11 seniors; $10.50 military and first responders with ID; free for ages 1 and younger. (585) 889-0770 or www.stokoefarms.com.
Rabbit Hole: A production of David Lindsay-Abaire’s award-winning drama,. 7 p.m. Oct. 24; 5 p.m. Oct. 25. School of the Arts, 45 Prince St. $10; $8 students, children and seniors; $5 SOTA students with ID. (585) 242-7682 or www.sotarochester.org.
RMSC Players: Live Science Performances: Exciting science demonstrations. 1 to 3 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays. Rochester Museum & Science Center, 657 East Ave. Free with museum admission. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org.
Rochester Area Literacy Council Conference: For young authors and illustrators. Students in grades 2-10 must be accompanied by an adult. Bill Schoff, a local poet and teacher, will keynote “Imagination and Expression.” Local author Kevin Kurtz will provide a workshop. 8:45 a.m. to noon Oct. 24. French Road Elementary School (Brighton), 488 French Road, Brighton. Free. Register by email or Karen_Speciale@eastiron.monroe.edu.
Saturday Night Skies: A concise tour of the stars, constellations and planets in the current sky uses new solid-state lasers to guide you through the magnificent star field. For ages 5 to adult. 7:30 p.m. Oct. 24. Rochester Museum & Science Center’s Strasenburgh Planetarium, 657 East Ave. $7; $6 for seniors, college students with ID and ages 3-18; free to ages 2 and younger. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org.
Saturday Sun, Moon and Stars: Family star show presenting prominent constellations that take audiences on a quick trip to the moon. Star show for ages 5-8 accompanied by an adult. 11 a.m. Oct. 24. Rochester Museum & Science Center’s Strasenburgh Planetarium, 657 East Ave. $7; $6 seniors, college students with ID and ages 3-18; free to ages 2 and younger. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org.
Science Encounters: Balance a bicycle wheel in one hand, explore nano-science, or meet some of RMSC’s live animal friends. Hourly, 10:15 to 3:15 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays. Rochester Museum & Science Center, 657 East Ave. Free with museum admission. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org.
Sid the Science Kid: The Super-Duper Exhibit: Children can step into Sid’s world and become science kids themselves as they discover and investigate everyday science questions around Sid’s home, and at school-in the Super Fab Lab and on the playground. Through hands-on activities, kids use scientific tools and thinking to learn about simple machines, the laws of motion, magnetism, air power, and the five senses. Through Jan. 24. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Free with museum admission. (585) 263-2700 or www.museumofplay.org.
Teen Anime Club: For ages 12-18. Lunch is provided. 12:30 p.m. Oct. 24. Registration required. Chili Public Library, 3333 Chili Ave., Chili. (585) 889-2200 or www.chililibrary.org.
Triple Threat Basketball: An introduction to basketball program that emphasizes the fundamentals and teaches sportsmanship. Open to ages 5-8. 9:15 a.m. to 10:15 a.m. Saturdays; Oct. 24 through Dec. 19. Greece Community and Senior Center, 3 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. $35. (585) 723-2425 or www.greeceny.gov/csc.
ZooBoo: Halloween event and fundraiser presented by Walmart, featuring trick-or-treating, educational activities and family photo opportunities. 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays, through Oct. 31. Seneca Park Zoo, 2222 St. Paul St. $8.50 plus zoo admission. (585) 336-7200 or www.senecaparkzoo.org.
Sunday
Electricity Theater: Featuring two custom-built, 6-foot Tesla coils modified to produce musical bolts of lightning. Noon, 2 and 4 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays. Rochester Museum & Science Center, 657 East Ave. Free with museum admission. (585) 271-1880, (585) 697-1942 or www.rmsc.org.
Fall Cursive Sundays: Writing In Cursive Class: Led by Ruth Rath, Leanna Hale and Mary Edwards. Open to ages 8 and older. 2 to 3 p.m. Oct. 25. Clarkson Academy, 8343 W. Ridge Road, Brockport. $3. (585) 637-5810.
Fall Family Fun at the Garden Factory: Activities for kids, Singing Pumpkin Light Show, carnival rides, arts and crafts, games, face painting, special visitors, petting zoo, animal rescue groups and more. 11 a.m. to 4 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays; through Oct. 25. Garden Factory, 2126 Buffalo Road, Gates. Free admission. ($10 for a book of 20 tickets). (585) 247-6236 or www.gardenfactoryny.com.
Gro-Moore Farms Fall Family Fun: Attractions (for families with children up to third grade) include the ABC’s of Agriculture Maze, No Left Turn Maze, Haunted House, The Fun House for Kids, a petting zoo, pumpkin slide and many fall scenes to enjoy. Special weekend activities run from 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays and include The John Deere Express Train Ride, Super Slide, Mini Golf, Tractor-drawn Wagon Rides, Duck Races, Tattoo Parlor, Pumpkin Painting, Trike Track, Straw Crawl for the little ones. 8 a.m. to 6:30 p.m. Monday through Friday; 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. Saturday and Sunday, through Oct. 31. Gro-Moore Farms, 2811 East Henrietta Road, Henrietta. Free; $10 per person for special weekend activities. (585) 359-3310 or www.gromoore.com.
National Chemistry Week: “Chemistry Colors Our World” hands-on experiments. 11 a.m. and 3 p.m Oct. 25. Rochester Museum & Science Center, 657 East Ave. Free with museum admission. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org.
Pumpkin Patch and Harvest Festival: Family friendly activities, including the Buffalo Bills Rex Ryan corn maze, zip lines, bounce pillows, nature trail, petting farm, hayrides, straw fort, giant slides, apple cannons and more. 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Saturdays and Sunday, through Oct. 25. Stokoe Farms, 656 South Road, Wheatland. $12; $11 seniors; $10.50 military and first responders with ID; free for ages 1 and younger. (585) 889-0770 or www.stokoefarms.com.
Rabbit Hole: A production of David Lindsay-Abaire’s award-winning drama,. 5 p.m. Oct. 25. School of the Arts, 45 Prince St. $10; $8 students, children and seniors; $5 SOTA students with ID. (585) 242-7682 or www.sotarochester.org.
RMSC Players: Live Science Performances: Exciting science demonstrations. 1 to 3 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays. Rochester Museum & Science Center, 657 East Ave. Free with museum admission. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org.
Science Encounters: Balance a bicycle wheel in one hand, explore nano-science, or meet some of RMSC’s live animal friends. Hourly, 10:15 to 3:15 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays. Rochester Museum & Science Center, 657 East Ave. Free with museum admission. (585) 271-1880 or www.rmsc.org.
Sid the Science Kid: The Super-Duper Exhibit: Children can step into Sid’s world and become science kids themselves as they discover and investigate everyday science questions around Sid’s home, and at school-in the Super Fab Lab and on the playground. Through hands-on activities, kids use scientific tools and thinking to learn about simple machines, the laws of motion, magnetism, air power, and the five senses. Through Jan. 24. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Free with museum admission. (585) 263-2700 or www.museumofplay.org.
Trick-or-Treating in the Historic Village: Dress in your Halloween costume and collect treats from the townspeople in the safety of the historic village. Warm yourself by the campfire and enjoy more family-fun activities. Noon to 4 p.m. Oct. 25. Genesee Country Village and Museum, 1410 Flint Hill Road, Mumford. Free to adults with trick-or-treaters. (585) 538-6822 or www.gcv.org.
ZooBoo: Halloween event and fundraiser presented by Walmart, featuring trick-or-treating, educational activities and family photo opportunities. 10 a.m. to 3 p.m. Saturdays and Sundays, through Oct. 31. Seneca Park Zoo, 2222 St. Paul St. $8.50 plus zoo admission. (585) 336-7200 or www.senecaparkzoo.org.
Monday
Autumn Leaf Collage: Overlay delicate silk leaves of different shapes and sizes to form a beautiful autumn collage on a wooden plaque. For ages 13 and older. 6:30 to 7:30 p.m. Oct. 26. Registration required. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org.
It’s Electric! Fun with Snap Circuits: Join our Snap Circuits Club and work with others to build fans, lights and sirens. For ages 8 and older. 3:45 to 4:45 p.m. Oct. 26. Registration required. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org.
Lego Club: For ages 6-12. 6:30 p.m. Oct. 26. Richmond Memorial Library, 19 Ross St., Batavia. (585) 343-9550 or www.batavialibrary.org.
Mother Goose Time: For ages 18 months and younger, accompanied by parent or caregiver. 10:30 to 11:30 a.m. Mondays. Victor Farmington Library, 15 W. Main St., Victor. (585) 924-2637 or www.victorfarmingtonlibrary.org.
Story Time Club: Activities are designed for 2- to 6-year-olds. 10:30 to 11:30 a.m. Oct. 26. The Strong, 1 Manhattan Square. Free with museum admission. (585) 263-2700 or www.TheStrong.org.
Story Time Stars: This class is designed to support early literacy skills in children, as well as encourage them to love books at an early age. 10:15 to 10:45 a.m. Oct. 26. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. Free. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org.
Toddler Story Time: For ages 15 months to 3, with an adult. 9:30 to 10 a.m. Oct. 26. Greece Public Library, 2 Vince Tofany Blvd., Greece. Free. (585) 225-8951 or www.greecelibrary.org.
Toddler Time: For ages 2-3 with a caregiver. 10:30 to 11 a.m. Oct. 26. Seymour Library, 161 East Ave., Brockport. (585) 637-1050 or www.seymourlibraryweb.org.
